intro: Euphrasia confusa, commonly known as the confused eyebright, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branched. Euphrasia confusa is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a perennial species with a fibrous root system.
